title: Item Set on Alpha Client?
body:
Is it possible for Riot Games to include "Item Set" (custom items) on Alpha Client?
I find custom sets very useful, not only it reminds you which item you should go for, it is also very efficient on choosing an item. Instead of searching for the item name, it will be more efficient to locate it instantly in your set and yous press/buy it, especially if you need a quick stop, let say Ekko, right click an item after recall then instantly ult back to join fight? or if you forgot an item name, instead of searching for its image or going through items one by one; long sword>tiamat> hydra. (Especially for the meta players who don't follow recommended items, they can just right click the item and buy it straight away)

   Pce Out~

replies.body:
pretty sure they've said somewhere that item sets are being removed.

edit: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/article/4ac7a0bc-8847-40cd-8efb-aa5aa3a660f4

>  Will the open beta be missing any features from the legacy client?
> 
Just a couple at the start. It'll take us a few patches to re-integrate spectate (for your friends and custom games) and the ability to join publicly hosted games using custom games. 
_**We're currently not planning to bring over the item set creator feature from the legacy client.**_ 
Basically only an incredibly tiny percentage of players ever used the feature, and we've heard from many players that y'all don't care whether we bring item sets over so long as we continue to support 3rd party item set customization tools like Championifyâ€”and we will!

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/230175788-Updated-Client-Open-Beta-FAQ

> One feature that isn't being immediately brought over from the legacy client are item sets. However, your existing item sets will still continue to work and our third-party API will sitll allow you to download custom item sets from community developers for in-game use.

They have since decided that they will introduce item sets to the new client, it just won't be straight away/a priority.

pretty sure this was always the case. they said they are not introducing an in client tool to create new sets but you can do so on the website in a browser then d/l it to you profile.

Guess we'll play the waiting game.
